text: Okay, so we are talking about loops and C and C discussed today. Loops and programming come into use when we need help to repeat execute a block of statements. For example, suppose we want to print hello world ten times. This can be done in two ways as shown below, and it method to do this to write the print of statement ten times. This is how we can write printed statements ten times and use it method. Okay. In loop, the statement needs to be written only once and the loop will be executed ten times as shown below. In computer programming, a loop with a sequence of instructions that are repeated until a certain condition is reached. An operation is done, such as getting an item of data and changing it, and then some condition is checked, such as whether a counter has reached a prescribed number. Counter not reached. If the counter has not reached the desired number, the next instruction in the sequence returns to the first instruction and the sequence and repeat it. Counter reached. If the counter has been reached, the next instruction falls through to the next eventual instruction or branches outside the loop. There are mainly two types of loops. Entry control loops in this type of loop stress conditions tested before entering the loop body. For loop and while loops are entry controlled, loops exit control loops in this type of loops, the test conditions is tested or evaluated at the end of loop body. Therefore, the loop body will execute at least once, irrespective of whether the test conditions true or false. Do while loop is exit control loop you can see here how loops are divided. An infinite loop sometimes called an endless loop is a piece of coding that lacks a functional exit so that it repeats indefinitely. An infinite loop occurs when a condition always evaluates to true. Usually this is an error. This is an empty for loop in which there is no initialization expression, no condition or no update expression. So this loop will run infinitely or will run forever.
